etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ار كج (er gec), from ار (er, “early”) and كچ (geç, “late”), equivalent to er (“early”) + geç (“late”). Cognates with Bashkir иртәме-һуңмы (irtəme-huñmı), Kazakh ерте ме, кеш пе (erte me, keş pe), Kyrgyz эртеби-кечпи (ertebi-kecpi), Tatar иртәме-соңмы (irtäme-soñmı), Turkmen ir-giç, Uzbek ertami-kechmi.
